meanings.definition: To come together for a meeting or assembly.
meanings.sent1: The students will convene in the library for their group project discussion.
meanings.sent2: The team will convene at the conference room to plan the upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: The animals decided to convene near the waterhole for their daily gathering.
meanings.sent4: Dark clouds convene in the sky, hinting at an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The colorful balloons convene in the sky, creating a festive atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: Neighbors convene at the park every evening for a friendly chat.
meanings.sent2: The crowd will convene at the stadium to watch the football match.
meanings.sent3: The toys convene in the playroom, waiting for the children to come and play.
meanings.sent4: Thoughts convene in his mind, forming a plan for the upcoming project.
meanings.sent5: Stars convene in the night sky, shining brightly for all to see.
